title: #Functions17
details:
Details
-------

TorontoJS is teaming up with other great local tech communities to bring a world-class conference to Toronto! Join us on August 25 for a full day with speakers from industry-leading FaaS companies and a panel discussion on the future of the FaaS tooling and infrastructure space! Tickets are $50, RSVP (https://functions.world) and pay by card or at the door. See you there!

\*\*\* RSVP at https://functions.world (http://functions.world/) \*\*\*

FaaS (Function as a Service) architecture is radically changing how software is built how teams interface with each other and systems at scale. The old paradigms of REST are being replaced with remote functions, event-driven architectures, and new standards like GraphQL. We're organizing a space for Creativity, Exploration, Discussion and Learning to help developers learn and get in touch with the industry leaders on these topics.

Join us for a full day event with speakers from industry leading FaaS companies and a panel discussion on the future of the FaaS tooling and infrastructure space!

[https://cdn.evbuc.com/images/34087980/2774739157/1/original.jpg](https://cdn.evbuc.com/images/34087980/2774739157/1/original.jpg)

\*\*\* RSVP at https://functions.world (http://functions.world/) \*\*\*

Speakers:

Kassandra Perch - IOPipe

Daniel Krook - IBM / OpenWhisk

Keith Horwood - [stdlib.com](http://stdlib.com)

Sandeep Dinesh - Google / Firebase

Adib Saikali - Pivotal / Spring Cloud Function

Stuart Charlton - Pivotal / Spring Cloud Function

Chris Munns - Amazon / AWS Lambda

Joe Raio - Microsoft / Azure

[https://cdn.evbuc.com/eventlogos/2755451/agendashort.png](https://cdn.evbuc.com/eventlogos/2755451/agendashort.png)

Functions17 is a collaboration between:

[https://cdn.evbuc.com/eventlogos/2755451/logos-1.png](https://cdn.evbuc.com/eventlogos/2755451/logos-1.png)

TechMasters Community  
Tech Masters is an online community ([https://techmasters.chat/](https://techmasters.chat/)) tying together a diverse and passionate group of technologists, entrepreneurs, and developers from all around the world. Join the Slack group for ongoing conversations and discussions.

Full Stack Toronto  
Full Stack Toronto is a non-profit that hosts monthly seminars ([https://www.meetup.com/full-stack-to/](https://www.meetup.com/full-stack-to/))and an annual conference that covers all layers of the web and the people who weave it! #fstoco is coming up Oct. 23-24th, 2017.

DevTO  
You love it, hate it, debug it, dream about it, obsess over it, test it, throw it away… because you don’t just write code. #DevTO ([https://www.meetup.com/devtoevents/](https://www.meetup.com/devtoevents/)), a place for all, regardless of age, experience or sex to gather and collaborate on the problems we face while developing applications.

Toronto Javascript  
Meet up ([https://www.meetup.com/torontojs/](https://www.meetup.com/torontojs/)) for those interested in all things JavaScript. Client side, server side, we love it all!

FunctionalTO  
This meetup ([https://www.meetup.com/FunctionalTO-meetup/](https://www.meetup.com/FunctionalTO-meetup/)) is about exploring functional, logic programming and interesting technical ideas primarily through (but not restricted to) PureScript & Haskell

Code of Conduct

Conference Code of Conduct ([http://en-us.confcodeofconduct.com/](http://en-us.confcodeofconduct.com/)) is in full effect, with zero tolerance. For any concerns please contact:

Ahmad Nassri | @AhmadNassri ([https://twitter.com/ahmadnassri](https://twitter.com/ahmadnassri))
